snippet: The finding is likely to add to the debate over rules that require most employers to provide free coverage of birth control to female employees.
abstract: Federal data shows that use of morning-after pills, also known as Plan B, by American women has more than doubled in recent years, driven largely by rising rates of use among women in their early 20s; finding is likely to add to debate over rules that require most employers to provide free coverage of birth control to female employees.
lead_paragraph: The finding is likely to add to the debate over rules that require most employers to provide free coverage of birth control to female employees.

headline.main: Use of Morning-After Pill Is Rising, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Use of Morning-After Pill Is Rising, Report Says

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
